function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Wearable technology not optimized for different groups with different lifestyles and circumstances, leading to discomfort and potential health issues.","Impact":"Reduced usability and potential health risks for users with specific medical conditions or lifestyles.","Mitigation":"Customization of wearable designs to cater to different user groups; inclusion of user feedback and testing during product development.","Technologies":"Optical sensor arrays, energy harvesting sensors, AI algorithms for personalized monitoring.","People":"Patients with respiratory diseases, individuals with specific lifestyle needs.","Owner":"Wearable technology designers and developers."},{"Description":"Limited computational and memory resources for model training and deployment on IoT devices, affecting the quality of healthcare AI algorithms.","Impact":"Reduced accuracy and quality of AI healthcare algorithms, potentially leading to misdiagnosis or ineffective treatment.","Mitigation":"Development of lightweight AI solutions for client-side processing; optimization of AI algorithms for resource-constrained devices.","Technologies":"Split AI architecture, multi-task convolutional network, energy harvesting sensors.","People":"Healthcare AI developers, IoT device manufacturers.","Owner":"AI and IoT technology companies, healthcare organizations."},{"Description":"Lack of energy-efficient wearable technology leading to rapid battery drainage and reduced usability.","Impact":"Inconvenience and limited functionality of wearables, reducing their effectiveness in monitoring and diagnosis.","Mitigation":"Integration of energy harvesting technology utilizing thermometric principle into wearables; development of energy-efficient algorithms.","Technologies":"Thermometric energy harvesting technology, smart algorithms, energy-efficient sensor designs.","People":"Users of wearables, healthcare professionals relying on wearable data.","Owner":"Wearable technology designers and developers."}]}
